data.enText: to annoy or upset sb by continuously asking them questions or for sth

data.chText: 整个星期她都受到新闻界的不断烦扰。
data.enText: She has been harried by the press all week.
to make repeated attacks on an enemy

word_means: 哈里；恶魔；胡闹的青年人；伦敦佬

means: 哈里；恶魔；胡闹的青年人；伦敦佬

tr: make a pillaging or destructive raid on (a place), as in wartimes

example: He is known to harry his staff when he is overworked
This man harasses his female co-workers

value.def: If someone harries you, they keep bothering you or trying to get something from you.

example.ex: He is increasingly active in harrying the government in late-night debates.
example.tran: 他越来越活跃，在深夜辩论中不断攻击政府。

example.ex: ...harried businessmen scurrying from one crowded office to another.
example.tran: 因业务缠身而在一个个拥挤的办公室之间奔忙的商人们

trans: 哈利波特；哈里波特；哈利波特系列
